allPostsData.title: Looking Forward
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: As Pith continues to develop, we're looking forward to what lies ahead in the design and development of the platform. There are a series of exciting phases that we've codified in three planned releases.

allPostsData.title: Summarization Design
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: In designing the summarization aspect to discussions, we've been faced with a plethora of options regarding both how the summary is created from existing blocks, and how it evolves as participants make edits.

allPostsData.title: Summarization and Moderation
allPostsData.author: Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: The bulk of phase II is summarization. Phase 1 focused on how people interact through the familiar interface of chat. Through phase II, we will be building a space for them to develop an ongoing-summary of their conversation.

allPostsData.title: Outlining Phase II of Prototyping
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: Having built a working prototype of the core chat functionality in Pith, we're moving on to the next phase of development in which we will address issues raised with the prototype so far and introduce summarization.

allPostsData.title: Feedback from Testing Phase I
allPostsData.author: Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: We tested the prototype website chat with a group of people informally. We gave them some time to chat among themselves and explore the features organically. People were able to pick up how to use multiple blocks in a post and tags fairly quickly.

allPostsData.title: Adding Transclusion
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: We've recently been working on adding a kind of hyperlinking functionality to the Pith prototype, called transclusion. Often, authors will want to quote a previous post and will cut out a section of it as a reference

allPostsData.title: Considering Searching
allPostsData.author: Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: We plan for our system to have many discussions going on at the same time. In a discussion, users can easily create posts which have smaller units of content called blocks.

allPostsData.title: Adding Basic Functionality to the Test Object
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: We've begun to integrate some of the functionality from last week's post into the test object. At the moment the goal is to keep the development focused on getting the essential features roughly implemented, and then coming back later and adding a minimum amount of styling to increase the functionality of the prototype as an object to be evaluated by our testers.

allPostsData.title: Designing a First Test Object
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms & Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: To begin to test out some of the features we've designed, we're creating a small protoype of the discussion interface. This test suite will serve as a way of evaluating the following design choices and features.

allPostsData.title: First Draft of Conversational Design
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms & Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: We've outlined a few goals for the design of the conversation in addition to features that help address them.  The system should be online to allow an arbitrary number of people anywhere to converse with each other.

allPostsData.title: Representing Discussion
allPostsData.author: Sydney Zheng
allPostsData.summary: How do we represent discussion in a way people can easily interact with? Discussion is more than just decision-making/debating. There are also the small conversations around this high-level process when people come to agreement on the meaning of related concepts

allPostsData.title: Pith: What is It?
allPostsData.author: Christian Broms
allPostsData.summary: Pith is an experimental method of facilitating discussions between many people online, building on the notion of an electronic direct democracy. Here are some of the key goals we're keeping in mind and the direction we're headed.
